name: State_7

timeline_beats.label: Proto-state consolidation under riverine trade lords
Great Naval War (major fleet actions; territorial loss/gain)
Territorial adjustments after Great Naval War

factions.label: Grand Maritime Guild
factions.influence_hint: Controls shipbuilding, port regulations, major trade concessions

factions.label: House Maren (coastal nobility)
factions.influence_hint: Holds fortified headlands and maritime levies

factions.label: Tide-Singers
factions.influence_hint: Ritual magics for navigation and weather; controls reagent access

factions.label: Harbor Workers' League
factions.influence_hint: Labor organization dominating loading, fish-processing, saltworks

factions.label: Corsair Hunters
factions.influence_hint: Privateers and naval militia specializing in anti-piracy

traits: port-based dialect with loanwords from Island Creole
festival calendar keyed to tidal cycles
workshop traditions in timbersmithing and ropecraft

external_relations_refs.label_hint: Territorial Shifts after Great Naval War

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries exist but cannot replace charts and seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
notes: Strategic chokepoints: North Anchorage harbor approaches and River-mouth narrows
Economy depends on steady reagent imports; reagent shortages destabilize Tide-Singers' power
Alliance A2 obligations affect fleet deployments and port access policies
Post-W1 border enclaves remain politically sensitive along southern shoals
